<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/13/0-25-million-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
From 0 to 25 Million in a Week
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everyone and their 14-year-old cousin is talking about “Apex Legends,” the new free battle royale video game from Electronic Arts (+5.23%). Since launching Feb. 4, the game has <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-electronic-arts-apex-legends-stocks/eas-apex-legends-tops-fortnite-record-with-25-million-signups-idUSKCN1Q11NA?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed up</a> 25 million users.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It took us 2.5 years to hit 1 million subscribers. Maybe we’re not providing readers enough opportunity to scavenge for loot?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Of course, the obvious comparison here isn’t the Brew…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...but fellow free battle royale game “Fortnite.” The cultural phenomenon from Epic Games took about four months to reach <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/11/18221014/apex-legends-25-million-player-milestone-respawn-battle-royale-ea?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">45 million registered players</a> (by last November, it hit 200 million).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Plus, it’s shown a knack for monetization: </strong>Sensor Tower <a href="https://sensortower.com/blog/fortnite-revenue-500-million-ios?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a> the <em>mobile version</em> of “Fortnite” has grossed more than a half a billion dollars on iOS, or $1.53 million per day.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Still, “Apex Legends” has come fast out of the gate</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a little hard to see, but check out the number of registered players on “Apex Legends” (in red) compared to the initial launch of “Fortnite” (purple).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1550003985.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Via </em><a href="https://twitter.com/thomasrice_au?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1095086025683025920&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Fapex-legends-player-count-2019-2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>@thomasrice_au</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is a much-needed break for EA.</strong> One week ago, it reported <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/electronic-arts-stock-heads-toward-largest-drop-in-more-than-a-decade-after-earnings-miss-2019-02-05?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disappointing earnings</a> and its shares suffered their worst single-day percentage drop in over a decade. But with a boost from “Apex Legends,” it’s full steam ahead to capitalize on the game.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">All the virtual world’s a stage</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This back-and-forth seems trivial compared to the remarkable event we saw on Feb. 2, when the EDM producer Marshmello played a set <em>in</em> “Fortnite.” For many, this signaled a new era not only of videogaming, but of reality itself.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Media writer Matthew Ball points us to the <strong style="color:#000">Metaverse, </strong>a term for “collective virtual shared space.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://redef.com/original/fortnite-is-the-future-but-probably-not-for-the-reasons-you-think?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">He wrote</a></span><span> that the Marshmello set “showcases the potential of the Metaverse (including payment for performances, music rights, etc.), wherein a user can have potentially unlimited experiences inside a single medium.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For EA, Epic Games, and other companies, the battle to control the Metaverse is on.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F02%2F13%2F0-25-million-week" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/13/half-apple-goes-brown-eventually?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Half an Apple Goes Brown Eventually
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s plan to create the “Netflix for news” is still buffering at 50%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s reportedly faced backlash from publishers over proposed financial terms for a news subscription service—namely, that Apple (+0.86%) wants to keep about half the revenue, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/publishers-chafe-at-apples-terms-for-subscription-news-service-11549998416?mod=hp_lista_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Let’s run through the details.</strong> Apple’s <a href="https://adage.com/article/digital/greedy-apple-half-publishing-subscription-sales/316619/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prospective service</a> would let users read an unlimited amount of content from participating publishers for a monthly fee.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It wants half of that subscription fee for itself...</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>...while the rest would get split among publishers based on how long users engage with their content.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But Apple could be jostled into dealmaking mode. </strong>This news subscription service is a part of its strategy to diversify revenue in the face of weakening iPhone sales (which fell 15% in Q4). Apple’s looking to increase its paid subscriptions across devices to 500 million by 2020 from today’s 360 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for the publishers, striking a deal means tapping into millions of sophisticated news junkies—and the prospect of expanding their own subscription bases.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/13/irs-irony?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
IRS Irony
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nowadays, it seems <em>three</em> things are certain: death, taxes, and using our phones to be productive during bathroom breaks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, eight million people used the TurboTax app to file their returns on a mobile device, and 20% of Credit Karma’s customers used their phones, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/12/your-money/taxes/file-taxes-phone-mobile-app.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the NYT</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>But</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">, </strong>while tons of people have turned to filing their taxes on their mini computers, IRS employees...weren’t answering their own phones.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following the partial government shutdown, a “shocking” number of taxpayer calls to the IRS have gone unreturned or been subjected to long bouts of Kenny G hold music, per a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/12/your-money/irs-government-shutdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">government audit</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And </span><span><em>during</em></span><span> the 35-day shutdown, over five million pieces of mail went unanswered and 87,000 amended tax returns unprocessed at the IRS.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Making matters worse: </strong>This is the first year the Trump administration’s tax code overhaul will affect everyday people, meaning tons of questions are flooding in. Oh, and the average tax refund? 8% <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/02/09/politics/tax-code-early-returns-data/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smaller</a> than last year so far this filing season.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/13/trains-pours?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When It Trains It Pours
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26hitAxPOGgrKD2vK/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wipe that smile off your face, Thomas. High-speed rail had a slow day...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">California calls it quits</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gov. Gavin Newsom said the state will abandon plans to create a $77 billion high-speed rail line between LA and San Francisco. It’ll “<a href="https://apnews.com/783b336c787a42fd9148986786ee73cf" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cost too much</a> and respectfully take too long.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FYI, the project was already years behind schedule with a disrespectful ETA of 2033.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But all’s not lost for you Agatha Christie fans. </strong>Newsom said California will <a href="https://www.axios.com/california-high-speed-rail-cancelled-gavin-newsom-abf6bc5e-a759-47ae-adcb-92b15cce139f.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">instead</a> focus on another route connecting Merced and Bakersfield in the Central Valley. The plan is to boost that region’s economic fortune.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Plus, Virgin Trains reconsiders</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Florida railroad Virgin Trains USA has <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-12/branson-branded-train-to-disney-to-be-biggest-2019-u-s-ipo-yet?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decided to postpone</a> what would have been the biggest IPO so far this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why was everyone so interested in its listing? </strong>Well, Virgin was a) losing money and b) behind on its own projections ahead of initial reports it planned to raise as much as $538 million in an IPO.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And why wait? </strong>The market is still jittery, Virgin was expected to be priced below its IPO range, and “alternative financing sources became available.”</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
THOUGHT LEADERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/13/bill-melinda-gates-speak?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When Bill and Melinda Gates Speak...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...people listen. Kinda like your dad on a road trip or Tony Romo in the booth. The power couple behind the Gates Foundation released their <a href="https://www.gatesnotes.com/2019-Annual-Letter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">annual letter</a> this week—the theme? <strong style="color:#000">Surprises.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/bill-and-melinda-gates-highlight-surprises-in-annual-letter/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highlights</a>:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">At-home DNA tests are powerful. </strong>You know genetic test results helped find the Golden State Killer, but did you know they can also help determine what causes preterm labor?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Gates Foundation helped fund a 23andMe study linking one gene to early births. And with 23andMe kits sold to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2018/09/05/23andme-considering-749-dollar-premium-service.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5+ million</a></span><span> people as of last fall, the future for similar studies looks bright.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">We will build an entire New York City every month</strong>...for the next four decades. While that’s good news for the hard-hat-wearing workforce, producing all the building materials required is bad news for the climate—manufacturing accounts for 21% of all greenhouse gases emitted.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. <strong style="color:#000">Textbooks are becoming obsolete. </strong>When education turns more to iPads than blackboards, you pay less for school. The Gateses said open courseware saves students on average $66-$121 per course.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F02%2F13%2Fbill-melinda-gates-speak" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+theme+this+year%3F+Surprises.&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/13/bill-melinda-gates-speak&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNowadays, it seems \u003cem\u003ethree\u003c/em\u003e things are certain: death, taxes, and using our phones to be productive during style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing the partial government shutdown, a “shocking” number of taxpayer calls to the IRS have gone unreturned or been subjected to The power couple behind the Gates Foundation released their \u003ca href=\"https://www.gatesnotes.com/2019-Annual-Letter?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannual letter\u003c/a\u003e this week—the theme? \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSurprises.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/bill-and-melinda-gates-highlight-surprises-in-annual-letter/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighlights\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAt-home DNA tests are powerful. \u003c/strong\u003eYou know genetic test results helped find the Golden State Killer, but did you know they can also help determine what causes preterm labor?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Gates Foundation helped fund a 23andMe study linking one gene to early births. And with 23andMe kits sold to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2018/09/05/23andme-considering-749-dollar-premium-service.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5+ million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e people as of last fall, the future for similar studies looks bright.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe will build an entire New York City every month\u003c/strong\u003e...for the next four decades. While that’s good news for the hard-hat-wearing workforce, producing all the building materials required is bad news for the climate—manufacturing accounts for 21% of all greenhouse gases emitted.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTextbooks are becoming obsolete. \u003c/strong\u003eWhen education turns more to iPads than blackboards, you pay less for school. The Gateses said open courseware saves students on average $66-$121 per course.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F02%2F13%2Fbill-melinda-gates-speak\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
